intro: Banksia octotriginta, commonly known as the eighty-three-needle banksia, is a striking plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence composed of numerous yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces long, cylindrical seed pods that remain attached to the stem for years, a feature known as a "persistence of the fruit." Its foliage consists of narrow, needle-like leaves that are typically grey-green in color. Banksia octotriginta is well adapted to fire-prone environments and plays an important role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
